description:
Tudor history has definitely been intriguing people for over 500 years now. Henry VIII is one of the most well-known British monarchs, mostly because of the number of brides he had over the course of his lifetime. This course is going to give you the straight facts on these lovely, but not so lucky, ladies that were married to such a huge figure of the 1500s.

Henry VIII had 6 wives: Katherine of Aragon, Anne Boleyn, Jane Seymour, Anne of Cleves, Katherine Howard, and Katherine Parr. We are going to go over the lives of these 6 Queens of England to learn about their personalities, their charitable contributions, and also any scandals that they might have been involved in.

This course is for anyone that loves Tudor history or even history in general. You will learn the truth about Henry's wives and why they became such a hot topic in history. Each lecture has at least one video for each Queen in order to tell their whole stories.

Taking this course will give you a much better understanding about how these 6 Queens truly lived and why they are still popular even 500 years later.
title: The Wives of Henry VIII
